013package org.apache.juneau.svl;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
017
018import java.io.*;
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.util.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
023
024/**
025 * A var resolver session that combines a {@link VarResolver} with one or more session objects.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * Instances of this class are considered light-weight and fast to construct, use, and discard.
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * This class contains the workhorse code for var resolution.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Instances of this class are created through the {@link VarResolver#createSession()} and
035 * {@link VarResolver#createSession(BeanStore)} methods.
036 *
037 * <ul class='notes'>
038 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not guaranteed to be thread safe.
039 * </ul>
040 *
041 * <ul class='seealso'>
042 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.SimpleVariableLanguage">Simple Variable Language</a>
043 * </ul>
044 */
045public class VarResolverSession {
046
047   private final VarResolver context;
048   private final BeanStore beanStore;
049
050   /**
051    * Constructor.
052    *
053    * @param context
054    *    The {@link VarResolver} context object that contains the {@link Var Vars} and context objects associated with
055    *    that resolver.
056    * @param beanStore The bean store to use for resolving beans needed by vars.
057    *
058    */
059   public VarResolverSession(VarResolver context, BeanStore beanStore) {
060      this.context = context;
061      this.beanStore = BeanStore.of(beanStore);
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Resolve all variables in the specified string.
066    *
067    * @param s
068    *    The string to resolve variables in.
069    * @return
070    *    The new string with all variables resolved, or the same string if no variables were found.
071    *    <br>Returns <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
072    */
073   public String resolve(String s) {
074
075      if (s == null || s.isEmpty() || (s.indexOf('$') == -1 && s.indexOf('\\') == -1))
076         return s;
077
078      // Special case where value consists of a single variable with no embedded variables (e.g. "$X{...}").
079      // This is a common case, so we want an optimized solution that doesn't involve string builders.
080      if (isSimpleVar(s)) {
081         String var = s.substring(1, s.indexOf('{'));
082         String val = s.substring(s.indexOf('{')+1, s.length()-1);
083         Var v = getVar(var);
084         if (v != null) {
085            try {
086               if (v.streamed) {
087                  StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
088                  v.resolveTo(this, sw, val);
089                  return sw.toString();
090               }
091               s = v.doResolve(this, val);
092               if (s == null)
093                  s = "";
094               return (v.allowRecurse() ? resolve(s) : s);
095            } catch (VarResolverException e) {
096               throw e;
097            } catch (Exception e) {
098               throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving variable ''{0}'' in string ''{1}''", var, s);
099            }
100         }
101         return s;
102      }
103
104      try {
105         return resolveTo(s, new StringWriter()).toString();
106      } catch (IOException e) {
107         throw asRuntimeException(e); // Never happens.
108      }
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Convenience method for resolving variables in arbitrary objects.
113    *
114    * <p>
115    * Supports resolving variables in the following object types:
116    * <ul>
117    *    <li>{@link CharSequence}
118    *    <li>Arrays containing values of type {@link CharSequence}.
119    *    <li>Collections containing values of type {@link CharSequence}.
120    *       <br>Collection class must have a no-arg constructor.
121    *    <li>Maps containing values of type {@link CharSequence}.
122    *       <br>Map class must have a no-arg constructor.
123    * </ul>
124    *
125    * @param <T> The value type.
126    * @param o The object.
127    * @return The same object if no resolution was needed, otherwise a new object or data structure if resolution was
128    * needed.
129    */
130   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
131   public <T> T resolve(T o) {
132      if (o == null)
133         return null;
134      if (o instanceof CharSequence)
135         return (T)resolve(o.toString());
136      if (o.getClass().isArray()) {
137         if (! containsVars(o))
138            return o;
139         Object o2 = Array.newInstance(o.getClass().getComponentType(), Array.getLength(o));
140         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(o); i++)
141            Array.set(o2, i, resolve(Array.get(o, i)));
142         return (T)o2;
143      }
144      if (o instanceof Collection) {
145         try {
146            Collection c = (Collection)o;
147            if (! containsVars(c))
148               return o;
149            Collection c2 = c.getClass().newInstance();
150            c.forEach(x -> c2.add(resolve(x)));
151            return (T)c2;
152         } catch (VarResolverException e) {
153            throw e;
154         } catch (Exception e) {
155            throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving collection.");
156         }
157      }
158      if (o instanceof Map) {
159         try {
160            Map m = (Map)o;
161            if (! containsVars(m))
162               return o;
163            Map m2 = m.getClass().newInstance();
164            m.forEach((k,v) -> m2.put(k, resolve(v)));
165            return (T)m2;
166         } catch (VarResolverException e) {
167            throw e;
168         } catch (Exception e) {
169            throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving map.");
170         }
171      }
172      return o;
173   }
174
175   private static boolean containsVars(Object array) {
176      for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(array); i++) {
177         Object o = Array.get(array, i);
178         if (o instanceof CharSequence && o.toString().contains("$"))
179            return true;
180      }
181      return false;
182   }
183
184   private static boolean containsVars(Collection<?> c) {
185      Flag f = Flag.create();
186      c.forEach(x -> {
187         if (x instanceof CharSequence && x.toString().contains("$"))
188            f.set();
189      });
190      return f.isSet();
191   }
192
193   private static boolean containsVars(Map<?,?> m) {
194      Flag f = Flag.create();
195      m.forEach((k,v) -> {
196         if (v instanceof CharSequence && v.toString().contains("$"))
197            f.set();
198      });
199      return f.isSet();
200   }
201
202   /*
203    * Checks to see if string is of the simple form "$X{...}" with no embedded variables.
204    * This is a common case, and we can avoid using StringWriters.
205    */
206   private static boolean isSimpleVar(String s) {
207      int S1 = 1;    // Not in variable, looking for $
208      int S2 = 2;    // Found $, Looking for {
209      int S3 = 3;    // Found {, Looking for }
210      int S4 = 4;    // Found }
211
212      int length = s.length();
213      int state = S1;
214      for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
215         char c = s.charAt(i);
216         if (state == S1) {
217            if (c == '$') {
218               state = S2;
219            } else {
220               return false;
221            }
222         } else if (state == S2) {
223            if (c == '{') {
224               state = S3;
225            } else if (c < 'A' || c > 'z' || (c > 'Z' && c < 'a')) {   // False trigger "$X "
226               return false;
227            }
228         } else if (state == S3) {
229            if (c == '}')
230               state = S4;
231            else if (c == '{' || c == '$')
232               return false;
233         } else if (state == S4) {
234            return false;
235         }
236      }
237      return state == S4;
238   }
239
240   /**
241    * Resolves variables in the specified string and sends the output to the specified writer.
242    *
243    * <p>
244    * More efficient than first parsing to a string and then serializing to the writer since this method doesn't need
245    * to construct a large string.
246    *
247    * @param s The string to resolve variables in.
248    * @param out The writer to write to.
249    * @return The same writer.
250    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
251    */
252   public Writer resolveTo(String s, Writer out) throws IOException {
253
254      int S1 = 1;    // Not in variable, looking for $
255      int S2 = 2;    // Found $, Looking for {
256      int S3 = 3;    // Found {, Looking for }
257
258      int state = S1;
259      boolean isInEscape = false;
260      boolean hasInternalVar = false;
261      boolean hasInnerEscapes = false;
262      String varType = null;
263      String varVal = null;
264      int x = 0, x2 = 0;
265      int depth = 0;
266      int length = s.length();
267      for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
268         char c = s.charAt(i);
269         if (state == S1) {
270            if (isInEscape) {
271               if (c == '\\' || c == '$') {
272                  out.append(c);
273               } else {
274                  out.append('\\').append(c);
275               }
276               isInEscape = false;
277            } else if (c == '\\') {
278               isInEscape = true;
279            } else if (c == '$') {
280               x = i;
281               x2 = i;
282               state = S2;
283            } else {
284               out.append(c);
285            }
286         } else if (state == S2) {
287            if (isInEscape) {
288               isInEscape = false;
289            } else if (c == '\\') {
290               hasInnerEscapes = true;
291               isInEscape = true;
292            } else if (c == '{') {
293               varType = s.substring(x+1, i);
294               x = i;
295               state = S3;
296            } else if (c < 'A' || c > 'z' || (c > 'Z' && c < 'a')) {  // False trigger "$X "
297               if (hasInnerEscapes)
298                  out.append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x, i+1), AS1));
299               else
300                  out.append(s, x, i+1);
301               x = i + 1;
302               state = S1;
303               hasInnerEscapes = false;
304            }
305         } else if (state == S3) {
306            if (isInEscape) {
307               isInEscape = false;
308            } else if (c == '\\') {
309               isInEscape = true;
310               hasInnerEscapes = true;
311            } else if (c == '{') {
312               depth++;
313               hasInternalVar = true;
314            } else if (c == '}') {
315               if (depth > 0) {
316                  depth--;
317               } else {
318                  varVal = s.substring(x+1, i);
319                  Var r = getVar(varType);
320                  if (r == null) {
321                     if (hasInnerEscapes)
322                        out.append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x2, i+1), AS2));
323                     else
324                        out.append(s, x2, i+1);
325                     x = i+1;
326                  } else {
327                     varVal = (hasInternalVar && r.allowNested() ? resolve(varVal) : varVal);
328                     try {
329                        if (r.streamed)
330                           r.resolveTo(this, out, varVal);
331                        else {
332                           String replacement = r.doResolve(this, varVal);
333                           if (replacement == null)
334                              replacement = "";
335                           // If the replacement also contains variables, replace them now.
336                           if (replacement.indexOf('$') != -1 && r.allowRecurse())
337                              replacement = resolve(replacement);
338                           out.append(replacement);
339                        }
340                     } catch (VarResolverException e) {
341                        throw e;
342                     } catch (Exception e) {
343                        throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving variable ''{0}'' in string ''{1}''", varType, s);
344                     }
345                     x = i+1;
346                  }
347                  state = 1;
348                  hasInnerEscapes = false;
349               }
350            }
351         }
352      }
353      if (isInEscape)
354         out.append('\\');
355      else if (state == S2)
356         out.append('$').append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x+1), AS1));
357      else if (state == S3)
358         out.append('$').append(varType).append('{').append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x+1), AS2));
359      return out;
360   }
361
362   private static final AsciiSet
363      AS1 = AsciiSet.create("\\{"),
364      AS2 = AsciiSet.create("\\${}")
365   ;
366
367   /**
368    * Returns the bean from the registered bean store.
369    *
370    * @param <T> The value type.
371    * @param c The bean type.
372    * @return
373    *    The bean.
374    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
375    */
376   public <T> Optional<T> getBean(Class<T> c) {
377      Optional<T> t = beanStore.getBean(c);
378      if (! t.isPresent())
379         t = context.beanStore.getBean(c);
380      return t;
381   }
382
383   /**
384    * Returns the {@link Var} with the specified name.
385    *
386    * @param name The var name (e.g. <js>"S"</js>).
387    * @return The {@link Var} instance, or <jk>null</jk> if no <c>Var</c> is associated with the specified name.
388    */
389   protected Var getVar(String name) {
390      Var v = this.context.getVarMap().get(name);
391      return v != null && v.canResolve(this) ? v : null;
392   }
393
394   /**
395    * Resolves the specified strings in the string array.
396    *
397    * @param in The string array containing variables to resolve.
398    * @return An array with resolved strings.
399    */
400   public String[] resolve(String[] in) {
401      String[] out = new String[in.length];
402      for (int i = 0; i < in.length; i++)
403         out[i] = resolve(in[i]);
404      return out;
405   }
406
407   /**
408    * Adds a bean to this session.
409    *
410    * @param <T> The bean type.
411    * @param c The bean type.
412    * @param value The bean.
413    * @return This object.
414    */
415   public <T> VarResolverSession bean(Class<T> c, T value) {
416      beanStore.addBean(c, value);
417      return this;
418   }
419
420   @Override /* Object */
421   public String toString() {
422      return "var=" + this.context.getVarMap().keySet() + ", context.beanStore=" + this.context.beanStore + ", session.beanStore=" + beanStore;
423   }
424}
